lexUnit.name: elation.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: a state of joyfulness and hapiness

sentence.text: As I walked down the front steps for the last time , a feeling of elation swept over me .
I remember my feeling of elation when I climbed aboard the train .
The participants in folk dance can and certainly do show elation .
Her elation took her into her clothes , back to the kitchen to leave Phoebe a scrawled memo , and out of the front door .
He even telephoned Wexford to tell him about it , his elation subsiding somewhat when he heard the chief inspector had also found this out three hours before .
In our elation there was some suspicion that our experience had been secret , adventurous , and unique .
So I was in a great state of elation .
A wave of cheerful elation swept over her as she separated her pound note from Yanto 's fivers .
The elation of witnessing birth may be followed by a sense of disorientation at being a displaced person .
` After each Test there was never any great sense of elation but rather that a step towards the ultimate goal was taken .
` You will not regret it , " the cardinal told her , observing the prince 's elation and guessing its cause .
Emily suddenly felt a surge of elation , she was eager for the new experience of being introduced into what she considered was the world of adulthood .
` If the manual was lying in the BMW , I think some hint of the elation of the police would have come through on the intercepts .
Then , as could happen with him , he felt a deep despondency replace his feeling of elation .
George drove past and felt a terrible anger replace his elation .
In fact they encouraged us most warmly , and we shared the general mood of elation at the overall success of the 1974 submission .
A surge of elation rushed through his body as he read the note for the third time , unable to believe the implications of what he was reading .
Figurative arts , even more than poetry , expressed the mixed feelings of elation over past victories and fear of future incursions which the Celts inspired .
But the sense of elation was short-lived .
My elation of the previous day began to evaporate until I remembered Agnes , the indentures I had signed , and the basic honesty of Ralemberg and de Macon .
Looking down at the dead man Wycliffe felt guilty because he was experiencing a sense of mild elation .
But when he stepped up on to the conductor 's rostrum for the opening production of a new season , he was -- every time -- filled with a sense of sheer elation .
But Richard 's elation at regaining his health was short lived because his kidneys started to fail .
